intro: Monogynella cassytoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and prairies. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
